DOC.brief_summary: this non-randomized prospective study of 2 longitudinal cohorts (surgical treatment group or orthopedic treatment group), will evaluate the hemodynamic repercussions of the correction (surgical and non surgical) of pectus excavatum-type thoracic deformities by measuring the cardiac output difference before and after intervention, measured by transthoracic impedancemetry, during an exercise stress test
DOC.brief_title: Hemodynamic Repercussions of the Correction (Surgical and Non Surgical) of Pectus Excavatum-type Thoracic Deformities
DOC.criteria: Patients seeking treatment of a pectus excavatum Haller index > 3.2 Desire for treatment age between 15 and 40 years old Cognitive impairment Pregnancy Contraindication to exercise stress test or general anesthesia Coagulation disorders
